From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Asturian

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

exiliar (first-person singular indicative present exilio, past participle exiliáu)

  1. to exile (to send into exile)
    Synonyms: esterrar, desterrar

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of exiliar
infinitive exiliar
gerund exiliando
past participle m exiliáu, f exiliada, n exiliao, m pl exiliaos, f pl exiliaes

tu 		third singular

vosotros/vós 		third plural
ellos

imperfect exiliaba exiliabes exiliaba exiliábemos, exiliábamos exiliabeis, exiliabais exiliaben
preterite exilié exiliasti, exiliesti exilió exiliemos exiliastis, exiliestis exiliaron
pluperfect exiliare, exiliara exiliares, exiliaras exiliare, exiliara exiliáremos, exiliáramos exiliareis, exiliarais exiliaren, exiliaran
future exiliaré exiliarás exiliará exiliaremos exiliaréis exiliarán
conditional exiliaría exiliaríes exiliaría exiliaríemos, exiliaríamos exiliaríeis, exiliaríais exiliaríen

Related terms

[edit]
  • exiliu

Further reading

[edit]
  • “exiliar”, in Diccionariu de la llingua asturiana [Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Asturian), 1ª edición, Academia de la Llingua Asturiana, 2000, →ISBN

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From exili +‎ -ar; compare Late Latin exsiliārī (“to be exiled”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [əɡ.zi.liˈa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [eɡ.zi.liˈaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

exiliar (first-person singular present exilio, first-person singular preterite exilií, past participle exiliat)

  1. (transitive) to exile
    Synonyms: bandejar, desterrar

Conjugation

[edit]

Derived terms

[edit]
  • exiliat

Related terms

[edit]
  • exili

Further reading

[edit]
  • “exiliar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “exiliar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “exiliar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “exiliar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From exilio +‎ -ar; compare Late Latin exsiliārī (“to be exiled”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /eɡsiˈljaɾ/ [eɣ̞.siˈljaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: e‧xi‧liar

Verb

[edit]

exiliar (first-person singular present exilio, first-person singular preterite exilié, past participle exiliado)

  1. (transitive) to exile
    Synonym: desterrar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of exiliar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)

gerund exiliando
past participle masculine feminine

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
